subject: RE: [junit] How can i test a geter or seter?
msgSnippet: Currently, there may be nothing that can go wrong with it.  But, putting a test in place will guarantee that if someone comes in and changes the implementation
messageBody:
Currently, there may be nothing that can go wrong with it. But, putting a test
in place will guarantee that if someone comes in and changes the implementation
of the method and begins to return something other than what the system is
expecting the test will break.
:)

-jason
--- "STRAYER, JON (AIT)" <jon.strayer@...> wrote:
> What could go wrong with this getter that is worth a test?
>
> >
> > class A {
> > private int i;
> > getI(){
> > return i;
> > }
> > }
> >
> > I want test the geter,should i make testcase as a inner class?
>


=====
-----------------------------------------
Keep it simple...
(1 Corinthians 2:2, Galatians 2:20, 6:14)
